(Reuters) - A teenager accused of fatally shooting 17 people at a Florida high school was investigated by police and state officials as far back as 2016 after slashing his arm in a social media video, and saying he wanted to buy a gun, but authorities determined he was receiving sufficient support, newspapers said on Saturday.  Nikolas Cruz, 19, is charged with committing multiple murders on Wednesday at the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland.  Days after the killings, a somber series of vigils and funerals were being held in and around Parkland, a Fort Lauderdale suburb of about 32,000 people.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-school-massacre-suspect-authorities-radar-2016-media-001337671.html</link><pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 09:37:48 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">florida-school-massacre-suspect-authorities-radar-2016-media-001337671.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/JT3wSCtmn3L8o6.n46IyRg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-18T143748Z_3_LYNXNPEE1G0K6_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-school-massacre-suspect-authorities-radar-2016-media-001337671.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/JT3wSCtmn3L8o6.n46IyRg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-18T143748Z_3_LYNXNPEE1G0K6_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Florida school massacre suspect on authorities&#39; radar in 2016: media" align="left" title="Florida school massacre suspect on authorities&#39; radar in 2016: media" border="0" ></a>By Katanga Johnson and Zachary Fagenson  PARKLAND, Fla. (Reuters) - A teenager accused of fatally shooting 17 people at a Florida high school was investigated by police and state officials as far back as 2016 after slashing his arm in a social media video, and saying he wanted to buy a gun, but authorities determined he was receiving sufficient support, newspapers said on Saturday.  Nikolas Cruz, 19, is charged with committing multiple murders on Wednesday at the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland.  Days after the killings, a somber series of vigils and funerals were being held in and around Parkland, a Fort Lauderdale suburb of about 32,000 people.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Father who forgave son for family&#39;s murder asks Texas to spare his life</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/father-forgave-son-familys-murder-asks-texas-spare-130830631.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/B3jWHdtf3xE.XBKVB_mD9w--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-18T130830Z_1_LYNXNPEE1H0AS_RTROPTP_2_TEXAS-EXECUTION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Father who forgave son for family&#39;s murder asks Texas to spare his life" align="left" title="Father who forgave son for family&#39;s murder asks Texas to spare his life" border="0" ></a>A Texas man who survived a deadly domestic attack hatched by his son is pushing the state to grant clemency to the condemned man, although it has never spared a death row inmate solely at the formal request of the victim's family.  In the 31 states with capital punishment, district attorneys make the decision whether to seek death, balancing the punishment that they consider best serves society with the wishes of the victim's family.  In this case, the local Texas prosecutors pursued death and jurors decided Bart Whitaker, 38, deserved to be executed.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/father-forgave-son-familys-murder-asks-texas-spare-130830631.html</link><pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:08:30 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">father-forgave-son-familys-murder-asks-texas-spare-130830631.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/B3jWHdtf3xE.XBKVB_mD9w--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-18T130830Z_1_LYNXNPEE1H0AS_RTROPTP_2_TEXAS-EXECUTION.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/father-forgave-son-familys-murder-asks-texas-spare-130830631.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/B3jWHdtf3xE.XBKVB_mD9w--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-18T130830Z_1_LYNXNPEE1H0AS_RTROPTP_2_TEXAS-EXECUTION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Father who forgave son for family&#39;s murder asks Texas to spare his life" align="left" title="Father who forgave son for family&#39;s murder asks Texas to spare his life" border="0" ></a>A Texas man who survived a deadly domestic attack hatched by his son is pushing the state to grant clemency to the condemned man, although it has never spared a death row inmate solely at the formal request of the victim's family.  In the 31 states with capital punishment, district attorneys make the decision whether to seek death, balancing the punishment that they consider best serves society with the wishes of the victim's family.  In this case, the local Texas prosecutors pursued death and jurors decided Bart Whitaker, 38, deserved to be executed.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Firearms debate rages as Florida rally coincides with gun show</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/firearms-debate-rages-florida-rally-coincides-gun-show-221410636.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ppJyvTR6PULXGLqoQ82FQg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T221410Z_1_LYNXNPEE1G0P4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Firearms debate rages as Florida rally coincides with gun show" align="left" title="Firearms debate rages as Florida rally coincides with gun show" border="0" ></a>By Katanga Johnson and Zachary Fagenson  MIAMI (Reuters) - Student survivors of a mass shooting that killed 17 people at a Florida high school called for gun restrictions on Saturday during an angry and somber rally, but attendees at a nearby gun show said firearms could not be blamed for the massacre.  Wednesday's shooting in the Fort Lauderdale suburb of Parkland fueled the long-running U.S. debate between supporters of tougher controls on firearms and advocates for gun rights, which are protected by the U.S. Constitution's Second Amendment.  Many at a rally in Fort Lauderdale that was organized to demand tougher gun laws rejected comments by U.S. President Donald Trump and others that mental illness was the main factor behind the slaughter at Margory Stoneman Douglas High School.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/firearms-debate-rages-florida-rally-coincides-gun-show-221410636.html</link><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:14:10 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">firearms-debate-rages-florida-rally-coincides-gun-show-221410636.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ppJyvTR6PULXGLqoQ82FQg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T221410Z_1_LYNXNPEE1G0P4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/firearms-debate-rages-florida-rally-coincides-gun-show-221410636.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ppJyvTR6PULXGLqoQ82FQg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T221410Z_1_LYNXNPEE1G0P4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Firearms debate rages as Florida rally coincides with gun show" align="left" title="Firearms debate rages as Florida rally coincides with gun show" border="0" ></a>By Katanga Johnson and Zachary Fagenson  MIAMI (Reuters) - Student survivors of a mass shooting that killed 17 people at a Florida high school called for gun restrictions on Saturday during an angry and somber rally, but attendees at a nearby gun show said firearms could not be blamed for the massacre.  Wednesday's shooting in the Fort Lauderdale suburb of Parkland fueled the long-running U.S. debate between supporters of tougher controls on firearms and advocates for gun rights, which are protected by the U.S. Constitution's Second Amendment.  Many at a rally in Fort Lauderdale that was organized to demand tougher gun laws rejected comments by U.S. President Donald Trump and others that mental illness was the main factor behind the slaughter at Margory Stoneman Douglas High School.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Facebook plans to use U.S. mail to verify IDs of election ad buyers</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/tech/facebook-plans-u-mail-verify-ids-election-ad-205341694--finance.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/llf9pxeVkAhz40SSMV_.Wg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T211434Z_2_LYNXNPEE1G0NK_RTROPTP_2_FACEBOOK-GERMANY-DATAPROTECTION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Facebook plans to use U.S. mail to verify IDs of election ad buyers" align="left" title="Facebook plans to use U.S. mail to verify IDs of election ad buyers" border="0" ></a>By Dustin Volz  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Facebook Inc will start using postcards sent by U.S. mail later this year to verify the identities and location of people who want to purchase U.S. election-related advertising on its site, a senior company executive said on Saturday.  The postcard verification is Facebook's latest effort to respond to criticism from lawmakers, security experts and election integrity watchdog groups that it and other social media companies failed to detect and later responded slowly to Russia's use of their platforms to spread divisive political content, including disinformation, during the 2016 U.S. presidential election.  Facebook revealed the plans a day after U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller unsealed an indictment accusing 13 Russians and three Russian companies of conducting a criminal and espionage conspiracy using social media to interfere in the election by boosting Republican Donald Trump and denigrating Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/tech/facebook-plans-u-mail-verify-ids-election-ad-205341694--finance.html</link><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 16:14:34 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">facebook-plans-u-mail-verify-ids-election-ad-205341694--finance.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/llf9pxeVkAhz40SSMV_.Wg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T211434Z_2_LYNXNPEE1G0NK_RTROPTP_2_FACEBOOK-GERMANY-DATAPROTECTION.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/tech/facebook-plans-u-mail-verify-ids-election-ad-205341694--finance.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/llf9pxeVkAhz40SSMV_.Wg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T211434Z_2_LYNXNPEE1G0NK_RTROPTP_2_FACEBOOK-GERMANY-DATAPROTECTION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Facebook plans to use U.S. mail to verify IDs of election ad buyers" align="left" title="Facebook plans to use U.S. mail to verify IDs of election ad buyers" border="0" ></a>By Dustin Volz  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Facebook Inc will start using postcards sent by U.S. mail later this year to verify the identities and location of people who want to purchase U.S. election-related advertising on its site, a senior company executive said on Saturday.  The postcard verification is Facebook's latest effort to respond to criticism from lawmakers, security experts and election integrity watchdog groups that it and other social media companies failed to detect and later responded slowly to Russia's use of their platforms to spread divisive political content, including disinformation, during the 2016 U.S. presidential election.  Facebook revealed the plans a day after U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller unsealed an indictment accusing 13 Russians and three Russian companies of conducting a criminal and espionage conspiracy using social media to interfere in the election by boosting Republican Donald Trump and denigrating Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Florida school massacre suspect on authorities&#39; radar in 2016: report</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/pressure-mounts-fbi-director-resign-florida-community-reels-090822643.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/SSMljWddEIHentFPhk.Q5w--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T090822Z_1_LYNXNPEE1G08X_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Florida school massacre suspect on authorities&#39; radar in 2016: report" align="left" title="Florida school massacre suspect on authorities&#39; radar in 2016: report" border="0" ></a>A teenager accused of shooting to death 17 people at a Florida high school was investigated by police and state officials as far back as 2016 after slashing his arm in a social media video, and saying he wanted to buy a gun, but authorities determined he was receiving sufficient support, a newspaper said on Saturday.  Nikolas Cruz, 19, is charged with committing multiple murders on Wednesday at the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, a Miami suburb.  More vigils and funerals were scheduled for this weekend in and around Parkland.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/pressure-mounts-fbi-director-resign-florida-community-reels-090822643.html</link><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:43:30 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">pressure-mounts-fbi-director-resign-florida-community-reels-090822643.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/SSMljWddEIHentFPhk.Q5w--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T090822Z_1_LYNXNPEE1G08X_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/pressure-mounts-fbi-director-resign-florida-community-reels-090822643.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/SSMljWddEIHentFPhk.Q5w--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T090822Z_1_LYNXNPEE1G08X_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Florida school massacre suspect on authorities&#39; radar in 2016: report" align="left" title="Florida school massacre suspect on authorities&#39; radar in 2016: report" border="0" ></a>A teenager accused of shooting to death 17 people at a Florida high school was investigated by police and state officials as far back as 2016 after slashing his arm in a social media video, and saying he wanted to buy a gun, but authorities determined he was receiving sufficient support, a newspaper said on Saturday.  Nikolas Cruz, 19, is charged with committing multiple murders on Wednesday at the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, a Miami suburb.  More vigils and funerals were scheduled for this weekend in and around Parkland.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Russian alleged election interference not working: McMaster</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/russian-alleged-election-interference-not-working-mcmaster-173031709.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Russian alleged election interference not working: McMaster" align="left" title="Russian alleged election interference not working: McMaster" border="0" ></a>By Andrea Shalal  MUNICH (Reuters) - Moscow's efforts to meddle in Western elections are backfiring, serving instead to strengthen and unify a broad range of people against Russia, top U.S. security official H.R. McMaster said on Saturday, a day after Washington indicted 13 Russian individuals and three Russian companies.  Russian officials denied the allegations, and one senior diplomat dismissed the charges as "fantasies" being used by some in Washington for political gain in a deeply divided United States after the election of Donald Trump as president.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/russian-alleged-election-interference-not-working-mcmaster-173031709.html</link><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 12:30:31 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">russian-alleged-election-interference-not-working-mcmaster-173031709.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/russian-alleged-election-interference-not-working-mcmaster-173031709.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Russian alleged election interference not working: McMaster" align="left" title="Russian alleged election interference not working: McMaster" border="0" ></a>By Andrea Shalal  MUNICH (Reuters) - Moscow's efforts to meddle in Western elections are backfiring, serving instead to strengthen and unify a broad range of people against Russia, top U.S. security official H.R. McMaster said on Saturday, a day after Washington indicted 13 Russian individuals and three Russian companies.  Russian officials denied the allegations, and one senior diplomat dismissed the charges as "fantasies" being used by some in Washington for political gain in a deeply divided United States after the election of Donald Trump as president.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Moscow says no evidence behind U.S. indictment of Russians for alleged election meddling</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/moscow-says-no-evidence-behind-u-indictment-russians-132857357.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Moscow says no evidence behind U.S. indictment of Russians for alleged election meddling" align="left" title="Moscow says no evidence behind U.S. indictment of Russians for alleged election meddling" border="0" ></a>MOSCOW (Reuters) - No evidence is behind the U.S. indictment of Russian nationals for alleged election interference and Moscow has given multiple explanations on what Washington called &quot;Russian meddling efforts&quot;, RIA news agency cited the Russian presidential envoy as saying on Saturday. The office of U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller has charged 13 Russians and three Russian companies, including the St. Petersburg-based Internet Research Agency, known for its trolling on social media. (Writing by Denis Pinchuk; Editing by David Holmes)<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/moscow-says-no-evidence-behind-u-indictment-russians-132857357.html</link><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 08:28:57 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">moscow-says-no-evidence-behind-u-indictment-russians-132857357.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/moscow-says-no-evidence-behind-u-indictment-russians-132857357.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Moscow says no evidence behind U.S. indictment of Russians for alleged election meddling" align="left" title="Moscow says no evidence behind U.S. indictment of Russians for alleged election meddling" border="0" ></a>MOSCOW (Reuters) - No evidence is behind the U.S. indictment of Russian nationals for alleged election interference and Moscow has given multiple explanations on what Washington called &quot;Russian meddling efforts&quot;, RIA news agency cited the Russian presidential envoy as saying on Saturday. The office of U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller has charged 13 Russians and three Russian companies, including the St. Petersburg-based Internet Research Agency, known for its trolling on social media. (Writing by Denis Pinchuk; Editing by David Holmes)<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>U.S. charges Russians with 2016 U.S. election tampering to boost Trump</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-russians-2016-u-election-tampering-boost-011309034--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. charges Russians with 2016 U.S. election tampering to boost Trump" align="left" title="U.S. charges Russians with 2016 U.S. election tampering to boost Trump" border="0" ></a>By Warren Strobel, Dustin Volz and Jonathan Landay  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A Russian propaganda arm oversaw a criminal and espionage conspiracy to tamper in the 2016 U.S. presidential campaign to support Donald Trump and disparage Hillary Clinton, said an indictment released on Friday that revealed more details than previously known about Moscow's purported effort to interfere.  The office of U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller charged 13 Russians and three Russian companies, including St. Petersburg-based Internet Research Agency known for its trolling on social media.  The official who oversees Mueller's work said the investigation was not finished.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-russians-2016-u-election-tampering-boost-011309034--finance.html</link><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 08:00:49 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-charges-russians-2016-u-election-tampering-boost-011309034--finance.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-russians-2016-u-election-tampering-boost-011309034--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. charges Russians with 2016 U.S. election tampering to boost Trump" align="left" title="U.S. charges Russians with 2016 U.S. election tampering to boost Trump" border="0" ></a>By Warren Strobel, Dustin Volz and Jonathan Landay  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A Russian propaganda arm oversaw a criminal and espionage conspiracy to tamper in the 2016 U.S. presidential campaign to support Donald Trump and disparage Hillary Clinton, said an indictment released on Friday that revealed more details than previously known about Moscow's purported effort to interfere.  The office of U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller charged 13 Russians and three Russian companies, including St. Petersburg-based Internet Research Agency known for its trolling on social media.  The official who oversees Mueller's work said the investigation was not finished.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/back-sandy-hook-lessons-spared-lives-florida-shooting-013321058.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting" align="left" title="&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting" border="0" ></a>"She was there that day in Sandy Hook and because of her I knew what to do," said Haneski, 57, a library media specialist at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, where a former student is charged with shooting dead 17 people on Wednesday.  Cech crammed 18 children and four adults into a small closet and locked the door as gunshots rang out.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/back-sandy-hook-lessons-spared-lives-florida-shooting-013321058.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 21:22:36 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">back-sandy-hook-lessons-spared-lives-florida-shooting-013321058.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/back-sandy-hook-lessons-spared-lives-florida-shooting-013321058.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting" align="left" title="&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting" border="0" ></a>"She was there that day in Sandy Hook and because of her I knew what to do," said Haneski, 57, a library media specialist at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, where a former student is charged with shooting dead 17 people on Wednesday.  Cech crammed 18 children and four adults into a small closet and locked the door as gunshots rang out.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, drawing anger</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/fbi-admits-failure-act-florida-school-gunman-draws-003827050.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/AbrWg00E9xsUIRPg2rK42Q--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T191033Z_3_LYNXNPEE1F1E8_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, drawing anger" align="left" title="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, drawing anger" border="0" ></a>By Bernie Woodall and Zachary Fagenson  PARKLAND, Fla. (Reuters) - The Federal Bureau of Investigation said on Friday it had failed to act on a tip warning that the man now accused of killing 17 people at a Florida high school possessed a gun, the desire to kill and the potential to commit a school shooting.  The disclosure sparked angry disbelief from residents of the Miami suburb of Parkland still reeling from Wednesday's massacre, the deadliest shooting ever at a U.S. high school, and led Florida's governor to call for the FBI chief to resign.  A person described as someone close to accused gunman Nikolas Cruz, 19, called an FBI tip line on Jan. 5, weeks before the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, to report concerns about him, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/fbi-admits-failure-act-florida-school-gunman-draws-003827050.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 21:22:36 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">fbi-admits-failure-act-florida-school-gunman-draws-003827050.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/AbrWg00E9xsUIRPg2rK42Q--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T191033Z_3_LYNXNPEE1F1E8_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/fbi-admits-failure-act-florida-school-gunman-draws-003827050.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/AbrWg00E9xsUIRPg2rK42Q--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T191033Z_3_LYNXNPEE1F1E8_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, drawing anger" align="left" title="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, drawing anger" border="0" ></a>By Bernie Woodall and Zachary Fagenson  PARKLAND, Fla. (Reuters) - The Federal Bureau of Investigation said on Friday it had failed to act on a tip warning that the man now accused of killing 17 people at a Florida high school possessed a gun, the desire to kill and the potential to commit a school shooting.  The disclosure sparked angry disbelief from residents of the Miami suburb of Parkland still reeling from Wednesday's massacre, the deadliest shooting ever at a U.S. high school, and led Florida's governor to call for the FBI chief to resign.  A person described as someone close to accused gunman Nikolas Cruz, 19, called an FBI tip line on Jan. 5, weeks before the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, to report concerns about him, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Facebook faces big challenge to prevent future U.S. election meddling</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/tech/facebook-faces-big-challenge-prevent-future-u-election-010138378--finance.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/08nVVciVT1q2CnVR73GpOw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T011309Z_3_LYNXNPEE1G02R_RTROPTP_2_FACEBOOK-SUICIDE.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Facebook faces big challenge to prevent future U.S. election meddling" align="left" title="Facebook faces big challenge to prevent future U.S. election meddling" border="0" ></a>By David Ingram and Dustin Volz  SAN FRANCISCO/WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The Russian influence operation designed to tamper with the 2016 U.S. presidential election used a combination of old-school espionage tactics and 21st-century technologies that will not be easy to stop, even now that the methods have been exposed, experts said.  Social media companies, especially Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc, have been under heavy pressure to find ways of stopping what is often referred to as "information warfare" on their services.  The indictment of 13 Russian nationals on Friday, announced by U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller, made extensive use of records from Facebook and Instagram, according to people familiar with the matter.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/tech/facebook-faces-big-challenge-prevent-future-u-election-010138378--finance.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 20:13:09 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">facebook-faces-big-challenge-prevent-future-u-election-010138378--finance.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/08nVVciVT1q2CnVR73GpOw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T011309Z_3_LYNXNPEE1G02R_RTROPTP_2_FACEBOOK-SUICIDE.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/tech/facebook-faces-big-challenge-prevent-future-u-election-010138378--finance.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/08nVVciVT1q2CnVR73GpOw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-17T011309Z_3_LYNXNPEE1G02R_RTROPTP_2_FACEBOOK-SUICIDE.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Facebook faces big challenge to prevent future U.S. election meddling" align="left" title="Facebook faces big challenge to prevent future U.S. election meddling" border="0" ></a>By David Ingram and Dustin Volz  SAN FRANCISCO/WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The Russian influence operation designed to tamper with the 2016 U.S. presidential election used a combination of old-school espionage tactics and 21st-century technologies that will not be easy to stop, even now that the methods have been exposed, experts said.  Social media companies, especially Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc, have been under heavy pressure to find ways of stopping what is often referred to as "information warfare" on their services.  The indictment of 13 Russian nationals on Friday, announced by U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller, made extensive use of records from Facebook and Instagram, according to people familiar with the matter.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Trump visits Florida hospital to pay respects after school shooting</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/trump-visits-florida-hospital-pay-respects-school-shooting-004137090.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Trump visits Florida hospital to pay respects after school shooting" align="left" title="Trump visits Florida hospital to pay respects after school shooting" border="0" ></a>POMPANO BEACH, Fla. (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump on Friday visited a hospital where victims of the school shooting in Parkland, Florida, were treated to &quot;pay their respects,&quot; a White House spokeswoman said.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/trump-visits-florida-hospital-pay-respects-school-shooting-004137090.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 19:43:53 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">trump-visits-florida-hospital-pay-respects-school-shooting-004137090.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/trump-visits-florida-hospital-pay-respects-school-shooting-004137090.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Trump visits Florida hospital to pay respects after school shooting" align="left" title="Trump visits Florida hospital to pay respects after school shooting" border="0" ></a>POMPANO BEACH, Fla. (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump on Friday visited a hospital where victims of the school shooting in Parkland, Florida, were treated to &quot;pay their respects,&quot; a White House spokeswoman said.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Confluence of crises crashes Trump&#39;s &#39;Infrastructure Week&#39;</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/confluence-crises-crashes-trumps-infrastructure-week-235848315.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/RR2_35Bv7XENpa9nUJH91A--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T235848Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1RH_RTROPTP_2_USA-BUDGET-INFRASTRUCTURE.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Confluence of crises crashes Trump&#39;s &#39;Infrastructure Week&#39;" align="left" title="Confluence of crises crashes Trump&#39;s &#39;Infrastructure Week&#39;" border="0" ></a>By Steve Holland and Roberta Rampton  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - This was supposed to be “Infrastructure Week” for U.S. President Donald Trump, a time to unveil a long-promised plan to create jobs by revitalizing America's roads and bridges.  Instead, the White House careened from crisis to crisis, with Trump's chief of staff fighting for his job, a mass shooting at a school in Florida, a fierce immigration battle on Capitol Hill and a report that a former Playboy model had an affair with Trump over a decade ago.  It was capped by news that the office of U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller had charged 13 Russians and three Russian companies with conducting an operation aimed at sowing political divisions and undermining democracy in the United States, including by meddling in the 2016 presidential election campaign.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/confluence-crises-crashes-trumps-infrastructure-week-235848315.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:58:48 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">confluence-crises-crashes-trumps-infrastructure-week-235848315.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/RR2_35Bv7XENpa9nUJH91A--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T235848Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1RH_RTROPTP_2_USA-BUDGET-INFRASTRUCTURE.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/confluence-crises-crashes-trumps-infrastructure-week-235848315.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/RR2_35Bv7XENpa9nUJH91A--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T235848Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1RH_RTROPTP_2_USA-BUDGET-INFRASTRUCTURE.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Confluence of crises crashes Trump&#39;s &#39;Infrastructure Week&#39;" align="left" title="Confluence of crises crashes Trump&#39;s &#39;Infrastructure Week&#39;" border="0" ></a>By Steve Holland and Roberta Rampton  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - This was supposed to be “Infrastructure Week” for U.S. President Donald Trump, a time to unveil a long-promised plan to create jobs by revitalizing America's roads and bridges.  Instead, the White House careened from crisis to crisis, with Trump's chief of staff fighting for his job, a mass shooting at a school in Florida, a fierce immigration battle on Capitol Hill and a report that a former Playboy model had an affair with Trump over a decade ago.  It was capped by news that the office of U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller had charged 13 Russians and three Russian companies with conducting an operation aimed at sowing political divisions and undermining democracy in the United States, including by meddling in the 2016 presidential election campaign.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>U.S. charges three with exporting drone parts to Lebanon&#39;s Hezbollah</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-three-exporting-drone-parts-lebanons-hezbollah-234654857.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. charges three with exporting drone parts to Lebanon&#39;s Hezbollah" align="left" title="U.S. charges three with exporting drone parts to Lebanon&#39;s Hezbollah" border="0" ></a>Federal authorities have charged three men with illegally exporting drone parts and other material from the United States to Lebanon's militant Hezbollah group, the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.  It said in a statement that suspects Usama Darwich Hamade and Issam Darwich Hamade were in custody in South Africa while Samir Ahmed Berro remained at large.  According to the indictment, the trio conspired and attempted to export goods including inertial measurement units suitable for use in drones, a jet engine, piston engines and recording binoculars to Hezbollah in Lebanon from 2009 to 2013, the statement said.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-three-exporting-drone-parts-lebanons-hezbollah-234654857.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:46:54 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-charges-three-exporting-drone-parts-lebanons-hezbollah-234654857.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-three-exporting-drone-parts-lebanons-hezbollah-234654857.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. charges three with exporting drone parts to Lebanon&#39;s Hezbollah" align="left" title="U.S. charges three with exporting drone parts to Lebanon&#39;s Hezbollah" border="0" ></a>Federal authorities have charged three men with illegally exporting drone parts and other material from the United States to Lebanon's militant Hezbollah group, the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.  It said in a statement that suspects Usama Darwich Hamade and Issam Darwich Hamade were in custody in South Africa while Samir Ahmed Berro remained at large.  According to the indictment, the trio conspired and attempted to export goods including inertial measurement units suitable for use in drones, a jet engine, piston engines and recording binoculars to Hezbollah in Lebanon from 2009 to 2013, the statement said.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/back-sandy-hook-lessons-saved-lives-florida-shooting-224749069.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting" align="left" title="&#39;Get back in here!&#39; Sandy Hook lessons spared lives in Florida shooting" border="0" ></a>"She was there that day in Sandy Hook and because of her I knew what to do," said Haneski, 57, a library media specialist at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, where a former student is charged with shooting dead 17 people on Wednesday. (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump on Friday visited a hospital where victims of the school shooting in Parkland, Florida, were treated to &quot;pay their respects,&quot; a White House spokeswoman said.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Monsanto loses bid to stop Arkansas ban on farm chemical</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/monsanto-loses-bid-stop-arkansas-ban-farm-chemical-232239058--finance.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/VShdkksjSESlz6i6c7np3A--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T232239Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1QQ_RTROPTP_2_MONSANTO-M-A-BAYER.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Monsanto loses bid to stop Arkansas ban on farm chemical" align="left" title="Monsanto loses bid to stop Arkansas ban on farm chemical" border="0" ></a>By Tom Polansek  CHICAGO (Reuters) - An Arkansas judge on Friday dismissed a Monsanto Co lawsuit aiming to stop Arkansas from blocking the use of a controversial farm chemical the company makes, dealing a blow to its attempts to increase sales of genetically engineered seeds.  Monsanto, which is being acquired by Bayer AG,  filed the lawsuit last year in a bid to halt the state's ban on sprayings of the weed killer known as dicamba from the period spanning April 16 to Oct. 31.  St. Louis-based Monsanto, the biggest U.S. seed company, said it was disappointed with the judge's decision and would consider additional legal action.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/monsanto-loses-bid-stop-arkansas-ban-farm-chemical-232239058--finance.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:22:39 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">monsanto-loses-bid-stop-arkansas-ban-farm-chemical-232239058--finance.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/VShdkksjSESlz6i6c7np3A--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T232239Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1QQ_RTROPTP_2_MONSANTO-M-A-BAYER.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/monsanto-loses-bid-stop-arkansas-ban-farm-chemical-232239058--finance.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/VShdkksjSESlz6i6c7np3A--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T232239Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1QQ_RTROPTP_2_MONSANTO-M-A-BAYER.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Monsanto loses bid to stop Arkansas ban on farm chemical" align="left" title="Monsanto loses bid to stop Arkansas ban on farm chemical" border="0" ></a>By Tom Polansek  CHICAGO (Reuters) - An Arkansas judge on Friday dismissed a Monsanto Co lawsuit aiming to stop Arkansas from blocking the use of a controversial farm chemical the company makes, dealing a blow to its attempts to increase sales of genetically engineered seeds.  Monsanto, which is being acquired by Bayer AG,  filed the lawsuit last year in a bid to halt the state's ban on sprayings of the weed killer known as dicamba from the period spanning April 16 to Oct. 31.  St. Louis-based Monsanto, the biggest U.S. seed company, said it was disappointed with the judge's decision and would consider additional legal action.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>&#39;Sinister and systematic attack&#39; by Russians prompts U.S. Congress calls for action</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/sinister-systematic-attack-russians-prompt-u-congress-calls-200450676--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="&#39;Sinister and systematic attack&#39; by Russians prompts U.S. Congress calls for action" align="left" title="&#39;Sinister and systematic attack&#39; by Russians prompts U.S. Congress calls for action" border="0" ></a>By Patricia Zengerle  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Republicans and Democrats both called for concerted action to combat foreign interference in U.S. elections after Special Counsel Robert Mueller announced indictments of Russians for meddling in the 2016 U.S. campaign on Friday.  "Today’s announcement underscores why we need to follow the facts and work to protect the integrity of future elections," Ryan said.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/sinister-systematic-attack-russians-prompt-u-congress-calls-200450676--finance.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:18:19 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">sinister-systematic-attack-russians-prompt-u-congress-calls-200450676--finance.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/sinister-systematic-attack-russians-prompt-u-congress-calls-200450676--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="&#39;Sinister and systematic attack&#39; by Russians prompts U.S. Congress calls for action" align="left" title="&#39;Sinister and systematic attack&#39; by Russians prompts U.S. Congress calls for action" border="0" ></a>By Patricia Zengerle  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Republicans and Democrats both called for concerted action to combat foreign interference in U.S. elections after Special Counsel Robert Mueller announced indictments of Russians for meddling in the 2016 U.S. campaign on Friday.  "Today’s announcement underscores why we need to follow the facts and work to protect the integrity of future elections," Ryan said.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>South Carolina teen who fatally shot two charged as adult</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/south-carolina-teen-fatally-shot-two-charged-adult-231230214.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/tFRC8oYEWS8cpJz2DVp2Lw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T235924Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1RF_RTROPTP_2_SOUTH-CAROLINA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="South Carolina teen who fatally shot two charged as adult" align="left" title="South Carolina teen who fatally shot two charged as adult" border="0" ></a>A 15-year-old accused of killing his father and driving to a South Carolina elementary school playground in 2016 where he opened fire and fatally wounded a 6-year-old student, will be tried as an adult, a South Carolina judge ruled on Friday.  Jesse Osborne faces from 30 years to life in prison if he is convicted on charges that include murder and attempted murder.  Prosecutors said Osborne, then 14, killed his father Jeffrey Osborne, 47, in September 2016 in their home in Townville, South Carolina, about 40 miles (64.4 km) from Greenville.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/south-carolina-teen-fatally-shot-two-charged-adult-231230214.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:12:55 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">south-carolina-teen-fatally-shot-two-charged-adult-231230214.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/tFRC8oYEWS8cpJz2DVp2Lw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T235924Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1RF_RTROPTP_2_SOUTH-CAROLINA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/south-carolina-teen-fatally-shot-two-charged-adult-231230214.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/tFRC8oYEWS8cpJz2DVp2Lw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T235924Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1RF_RTROPTP_2_SOUTH-CAROLINA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="South Carolina teen who fatally shot two charged as adult" align="left" title="South Carolina teen who fatally shot two charged as adult" border="0" ></a>A 15-year-old accused of killing his father and driving to a South Carolina elementary school playground in 2016 where he opened fire and fatally wounded a 6-year-old student, will be tried as an adult, a South Carolina judge ruled on Friday.  Jesse Osborne faces from 30 years to life in prison if he is convicted on charges that include murder and attempted murder.  Prosecutors said Osborne, then 14, killed his father Jeffrey Osborne, 47, in September 2016 in their home in Townville, South Carolina, about 40 miles (64.4 km) from Greenville.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, draws anger</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/grief-anger-florida-prepares-bury-victims-school-massacre-093225859.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/rNkenGihEDliydn3G.CzFA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T175606Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1E8_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, draws anger" align="left" title="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, draws anger" border="0" ></a>By Bernie Woodall and Zachary Fagenson  PARKLAND, Fla. (Reuters) - The Federal Bureau of Investigation on Friday said it failed to act on a tip that the teenager accused of killing 17 people in Florida had guns and the desire to kill, drawing calls from Florida's Republican governor for the FBI director to resign.  A person close to accused gunman Nikolas Cruz contacted an FBI tip line on Jan. 5 to report concerns about him, the FBI said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/grief-anger-florida-prepares-bury-victims-school-massacre-093225859.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:01:24 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">grief-anger-florida-prepares-bury-victims-school-massacre-093225859.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/rNkenGihEDliydn3G.CzFA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T175606Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1E8_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/grief-anger-florida-prepares-bury-victims-school-massacre-093225859.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/rNkenGihEDliydn3G.CzFA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T175606Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1E8_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, draws anger" align="left" title="FBI admits failure to act on Florida school gunman, draws anger" border="0" ></a>By Bernie Woodall and Zachary Fagenson  PARKLAND, Fla. (Reuters) - The Federal Bureau of Investigation on Friday said it failed to act on a tip that the teenager accused of killing 17 people in Florida had guns and the desire to kill, drawing calls from Florida's Republican governor for the FBI director to resign.  A person close to accused gunman Nikolas Cruz contacted an FBI tip line on Jan. 5 to report concerns about him, the FBI said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>15-year-old boy charged with murder, assault in Kentucky school shooting</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/15-old-boy-charged-murder-assault-kentucky-school-214426835.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="15-year-old boy charged with murder, assault in Kentucky school shooting" align="left" title="15-year-old boy charged with murder, assault in Kentucky school shooting" border="0" ></a>A judge entered a plea of not guilty on his behalf, Marshall County Circuit Court Clerk Tiffany Griffith said.  The suspect, Nikolas Cruz, 19, a gun owner who had been expelled from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, was charged on Thursday with 17 counts of premeditated murder.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/15-old-boy-charged-murder-assault-kentucky-school-214426835.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 17:18:23 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">15-old-boy-charged-murder-assault-kentucky-school-214426835.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/15-old-boy-charged-murder-assault-kentucky-school-214426835.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="15-year-old boy charged with murder, assault in Kentucky school shooting" align="left" title="15-year-old boy charged with murder, assault in Kentucky school shooting" border="0" ></a>A judge entered a plea of not guilty on his behalf, Marshall County Circuit Court Clerk Tiffany Griffith said.  The suspect, Nikolas Cruz, 19, a gun owner who had been expelled from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, was charged on Thursday with 17 counts of premeditated murder.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>&#39;NO COLLUSION:&#39; Trump says vindicated by Russia meddling indictments</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/no-collusion-trump-says-vindicated-russia-meddling-indictments-205906249.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="&#39;NO COLLUSION:&#39; Trump says vindicated by Russia meddling indictments" align="left" title="&#39;NO COLLUSION:&#39; Trump says vindicated by Russia meddling indictments" border="0" ></a>The White House on Friday declared that U.S. indictments of Russians for meddling in the 2016 presidential election showed that the campaign of President Donald Trump had nothing to do with an issue that has overshadowed his year in office.  Trump, who was briefed on the indictments, was "glad to see the Special Counsel’s investigation further indicates - that there was NO COLLUSION between the Trump campaign and Russia and that the outcome of the election was not changed or affected," the White House said in a statement.  "It’s time we stop the outlandish partisan attacks, wild and false allegations, and far-fetched theories, which only serve to further the agendas of bad actors, like Russia, and do nothing to protect the principles of our institutions," Trump said in the statement.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/no-collusion-trump-says-vindicated-russia-meddling-indictments-205906249.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:35:47 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">no-collusion-trump-says-vindicated-russia-meddling-indictments-205906249.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/no-collusion-trump-says-vindicated-russia-meddling-indictments-205906249.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="&#39;NO COLLUSION:&#39; Trump says vindicated by Russia meddling indictments" align="left" title="&#39;NO COLLUSION:&#39; Trump says vindicated by Russia meddling indictments" border="0" ></a>The White House on Friday declared that U.S. indictments of Russians for meddling in the 2016 presidential election showed that the campaign of President Donald Trump had nothing to do with an issue that has overshadowed his year in office.  Trump, who was briefed on the indictments, was "glad to see the Special Counsel’s investigation further indicates - that there was NO COLLUSION between the Trump campaign and Russia and that the outcome of the election was not changed or affected," the White House said in a statement.  "It’s time we stop the outlandish partisan attacks, wild and false allegations, and far-fetched theories, which only serve to further the agendas of bad actors, like Russia, and do nothing to protect the principles of our institutions," Trump said in the statement.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Yemeni man pleads guilty in U.S. to trying to join Islamic State</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/yemeni-man-pleads-guilty-u-trying-join-islamic-211708825.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Yemeni man pleads guilty in U.S. to trying to join Islamic State" align="left" title="Yemeni man pleads guilty in U.S. to trying to join Islamic State" border="0" ></a>A Yemen-born New York City resident on Friday pleaded guilty to attempting to provide support to Islamic State, admitting that he tried to join the organization and urged someone else to join too.  Mohamed Rafik Naji entered his plea to one count of attempting to provide material support to a foreign terrorist organization at a hearing before U.S. District Judge Frederic Block in Brooklyn.  "I traveled to Yemen in 2015 to join ISIS and I encouraged another person to join," Naji said at the hearing, using a common acronym for Islamic State.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/yemeni-man-pleads-guilty-u-trying-join-islamic-211708825.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:17:08 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">yemeni-man-pleads-guilty-u-trying-join-islamic-211708825.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/yemeni-man-pleads-guilty-u-trying-join-islamic-211708825.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Yemeni man pleads guilty in U.S. to trying to join Islamic State" align="left" title="Yemeni man pleads guilty in U.S. to trying to join Islamic State" border="0" ></a>A Yemen-born New York City resident on Friday pleaded guilty to attempting to provide support to Islamic State, admitting that he tried to join the organization and urged someone else to join too.  Mohamed Rafik Naji entered his plea to one count of attempting to provide material support to a foreign terrorist organization at a hearing before U.S. District Judge Frederic Block in Brooklyn.  "I traveled to Yemen in 2015 to join ISIS and I encouraged another person to join," Naji said at the hearing, using a common acronym for Islamic State.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Maryland jury awards $37 million to family of woman shot by police: report</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/maryland-jury-awards-37-million-family-woman-shot-211348188.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Maryland jury awards $37 million to family of woman shot by police: report" align="left" title="Maryland jury awards $37 million to family of woman shot by police: report" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - A Maryland jury has awarded more than $37 million in damages to the family of an armed black woman who was fatally shot by Baltimore County police in a 2016 standoff, the Baltimore Sun reported on Friday.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/maryland-jury-awards-37-million-family-woman-shot-211348188.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:13:48 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">maryland-jury-awards-37-million-family-woman-shot-211348188.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/maryland-jury-awards-37-million-family-woman-shot-211348188.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Maryland jury awards $37 million to family of woman shot by police: report" align="left" title="Maryland jury awards $37 million to family of woman shot by police: report" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - A Maryland jury has awarded more than $37 million in damages to the family of an armed black woman who was fatally shot by Baltimore County police in a 2016 standoff, the Baltimore Sun reported on Friday.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>NY judge rules Charter Communications must face lawsuit over slow internet</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/n-y-judge-says-charter-must-face-lawsuit-194710896--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="NY judge rules Charter Communications must face lawsuit over slow internet" align="left" title="NY judge rules Charter Communications must face lawsuit over slow internet" border="0" ></a>Charter Communications Inc must face a lawsuit by New York's attorney general accusing the cable company of providing customers slower-than-advertised internet speeds, a New York state judge ruled.  Justice O. Peter Sherwood of the state Supreme Court in Manhattan rejected Charter's claim that Attorney General Eric Schneiderman failed to plausibly allege the company had short-changed and misled customers.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/n-y-judge-says-charter-must-face-lawsuit-194710896--finance.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:10:09 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">n-y-judge-says-charter-must-face-lawsuit-194710896--finance.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/n-y-judge-says-charter-must-face-lawsuit-194710896--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="NY judge rules Charter Communications must face lawsuit over slow internet" align="left" title="NY judge rules Charter Communications must face lawsuit over slow internet" border="0" ></a>Charter Communications Inc must face a lawsuit by New York's attorney general accusing the cable company of providing customers slower-than-advertised internet speeds, a New York state judge ruled.  Justice O. Peter Sherwood of the state Supreme Court in Manhattan rejected Charter's claim that Attorney General Eric Schneiderman failed to plausibly allege the company had short-changed and misled customers.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>U.S. man indicted for identity fraud in Russia probe &#39;made a mistake&#39;: lawyer</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/california-man-pleads-guilty-identity-fraud-mueller-probe-193652230--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. man indicted for identity fraud in Russia probe &#39;made a mistake&#39;: lawyer" align="left" title="U.S. man indicted for identity fraud in Russia probe &#39;made a mistake&#39;: lawyer" border="0" ></a>A U.S. man indicted for identity fraud in Special Counsel Robert Mueller's probe into possible Russian meddling in the 2016 election "made a mistake" but "had absolutely no knowledge" about who was buying the information or their motivations, his lawyer said on Friday.  Jeremy Lessem, a Los Angeles attorney representing Richard Pinedo Jr., said in a statement his client "sold bank information which allowed individuals to fraudulently verify and establish accounts with online financial institutions," but said he "had absolutely no knowledge of the identities and motivations of any of the purchasers of the information he provided."  According to a source familiar with indictments announced by the Justice Department on Friday, Pinedo is named as helping Russian conspirators launder money as well as purchase Facebook ads and pay for rally supplies, through PayPal Holdings Inc as part of criminal and espionage conspiracy to intervene in the 2016 U.S. election campaign to support Donald Trump and disparage rival Hillary Clinton.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/california-man-pleads-guilty-identity-fraud-mueller-probe-193652230--finance.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:01:31 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">california-man-pleads-guilty-identity-fraud-mueller-probe-193652230--finance.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/california-man-pleads-guilty-identity-fraud-mueller-probe-193652230--finance.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. man indicted for identity fraud in Russia probe &#39;made a mistake&#39;: lawyer" align="left" title="U.S. man indicted for identity fraud in Russia probe &#39;made a mistake&#39;: lawyer" border="0" ></a>A U.S. man indicted for identity fraud in Special Counsel Robert Mueller's probe into possible Russian meddling in the 2016 election "made a mistake" but "had absolutely no knowledge" about who was buying the information or their motivations, his lawyer said on Friday.  Jeremy Lessem, a Los Angeles attorney representing Richard Pinedo Jr., said in a statement his client "sold bank information which allowed individuals to fraudulently verify and establish accounts with online financial institutions," but said he "had absolutely no knowledge of the identities and motivations of any of the purchasers of the information he provided."  According to a source familiar with indictments announced by the Justice Department on Friday, Pinedo is named as helping Russian conspirators launder money as well as purchase Facebook ads and pay for rally supplies, through PayPal Holdings Inc as part of criminal and espionage conspiracy to intervene in the 2016 U.S. election campaign to support Donald Trump and disparage rival Hillary Clinton.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Factbox: Effort to sway election included &#39;Clinton&#39; in prison garb - indictment</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-effort-sway-election-included-clinton-prison-garb-204309676.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Factbox: Effort to sway election included &#39;Clinton&#39; in prison garb - indictment" align="left" title="Factbox: Effort to sway election included &#39;Clinton&#39; in prison garb - indictment" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - A multipronged effort to sway the 2016 U.S. presidential election in favor of Republican Donald Trump and against his Democratic rival Hillary Clinton included a Florida rally with an actress portraying Clinton in a prison uniform, according to an indictment released on Friday.  Rallies for Trump, a "Support Hillary, Save American Muslims" rally and a "Down with Hillary" rally were also part of a project to interfere in the election, the U.S. special counsel said in an indictment of 13 Russians and a Russian Internet agency.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-effort-sway-election-included-clinton-prison-garb-204309676.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:43:09 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">factbox-effort-sway-election-included-clinton-prison-garb-204309676.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-effort-sway-election-included-clinton-prison-garb-204309676.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Factbox: Effort to sway election included &#39;Clinton&#39; in prison garb - indictment" align="left" title="Factbox: Effort to sway election included &#39;Clinton&#39; in prison garb - indictment" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - A multipronged effort to sway the 2016 U.S. presidential election in favor of Republican Donald Trump and against his Democratic rival Hillary Clinton included a Florida rally with an actress portraying Clinton in a prison uniform, according to an indictment released on Friday.  Rallies for Trump, a "Support Hillary, Save American Muslims" rally and a "Down with Hillary" rally were also part of a project to interfere in the election, the U.S. special counsel said in an indictment of 13 Russians and a Russian Internet agency.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Gunfire rumors prompt brief lockdown at Washington state college</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/police-respond-reports-gunfire-washington-college-174231008.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Gunfire rumors prompt brief lockdown at Washington state college" align="left" title="Gunfire rumors prompt brief lockdown at Washington state college" border="0" ></a>The brief scare prompted the cancellation of classes and a search for a gunman at Highline College in Des Moines, Washington, that officials said came up empty.  "We are done searching the campus and have found no injuries or indications of gunshots being fired," Kent Police Commander Jarod Kasner said in an email around midday, about two hours after the lockdown was declared.  The alarming warning came just days after a gunman entered a school in Parkland, Florida, killing 17 people and injuring others in one of the worst school shootings in U.S. history.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/police-respond-reports-gunfire-washington-college-174231008.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:26:27 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">police-respond-reports-gunfire-washington-college-174231008.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/police-respond-reports-gunfire-washington-college-174231008.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Gunfire rumors prompt brief lockdown at Washington state college" align="left" title="Gunfire rumors prompt brief lockdown at Washington state college" border="0" ></a>The brief scare prompted the cancellation of classes and a search for a gunman at Highline College in Des Moines, Washington, that officials said came up empty.  "We are done searching the campus and have found no injuries or indications of gunshots being fired," Kent Police Commander Jarod Kasner said in an email around midday, about two hours after the lockdown was declared.  The alarming warning came just days after a gunman entered a school in Parkland, Florida, killing 17 people and injuring others in one of the worst school shootings in U.S. history.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>U.S. top court mulls whether to take up &#39;Dreamers&#39; dispute</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-supreme-court-weighs-intervening-dreamers-problem-154648952.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/yCvBVpVO.St4NqpcCTMHyg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T154648Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F194_RTROPTP_2_USA-COURT-TRUMP.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. top court mulls whether to take up &#39;Dreamers&#39; dispute" align="left" title="U.S. top court mulls whether to take up &#39;Dreamers&#39; dispute" border="0" ></a>The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday discussed in private how to handle President Donald Trump's appeal of a judge's decision blocking his plan to end protections for young illegal immigrants dubbed "Dreamers," and the nine justices could announce as early as Tuesday whether they will take up the case.  Trump's administration is appealing San Francisco-based U.S. District Judge William Alsup's Jan. 9 ruling that halted the president's order to end the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program, which protects from deportation young adults who came into country illegally as children and gives them work permits.  U.S. lawmakers have been working to resolve the fate of the hundreds of thousands of young adults, mostly Hispanics, protected by the program, but legislation that would have done so failed in the Senate on Thursday.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-supreme-court-weighs-intervening-dreamers-problem-154648952.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:13:06 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-supreme-court-weighs-intervening-dreamers-problem-154648952.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/yCvBVpVO.St4NqpcCTMHyg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T154648Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F194_RTROPTP_2_USA-COURT-TRUMP.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-supreme-court-weighs-intervening-dreamers-problem-154648952.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/yCvBVpVO.St4NqpcCTMHyg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T154648Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F194_RTROPTP_2_USA-COURT-TRUMP.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. top court mulls whether to take up &#39;Dreamers&#39; dispute" align="left" title="U.S. top court mulls whether to take up &#39;Dreamers&#39; dispute" border="0" ></a>The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday discussed in private how to handle President Donald Trump's appeal of a judge's decision blocking his plan to end protections for young illegal immigrants dubbed "Dreamers," and the nine justices could announce as early as Tuesday whether they will take up the case.  Trump's administration is appealing San Francisco-based U.S. District Judge William Alsup's Jan. 9 ruling that halted the president's order to end the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program, which protects from deportation young adults who came into country illegally as children and gives them work permits.  U.S. lawmakers have been working to resolve the fate of the hundreds of thousands of young adults, mostly Hispanics, protected by the program, but legislation that would have done so failed in the Senate on Thursday.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Sessions orders review of federal response to violence warnings</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/sessions-orders-review-federal-response-violence-warnings-200218982.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Sessions orders review of federal response to violence warnings" align="left" title="Sessions orders review of federal response to violence warnings" border="0" ></a>WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions said on Friday he had ordered an immediate review of how the Justice Department and the FBI respond to warnings about potential violence such as the mass shooting at a Florida high school this week. &quot;This includes more than just an error review but also a review of how we respond,&quot; Sessions said in a statement. &quot;This will include possible consultation with family members, mental health officials, school officials, and local law enforcement.&quot; (Reporting by Susan Heavey and Justin Mitchell; Editing by Tom Brown)<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/sessions-orders-review-federal-response-violence-warnings-200218982.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:02:18 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">sessions-orders-review-federal-response-violence-warnings-200218982.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/sessions-orders-review-federal-response-violence-warnings-200218982.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Sessions orders review of federal response to violence warnings" align="left" title="Sessions orders review of federal response to violence warnings" border="0" ></a>WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions said on Friday he had ordered an immediate review of how the Justice Department and the FBI respond to warnings about potential violence such as the mass shooting at a Florida high school this week. &quot;This includes more than just an error review but also a review of how we respond,&quot; Sessions said in a statement. &quot;This will include possible consultation with family members, mental health officials, school officials, and local law enforcement.&quot; (Reporting by Susan Heavey and Justin Mitchell;
