Yes,&quot; Zakharova wrote in a post on Facebook.  ...<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>FBI says it did not properly follow-up tip on accused Florida shooter</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/fbi-says-did-not-properly-tip-accused-florida-175413819.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="FBI says it did not properly follow-up tip on accused Florida shooter" align="left" title="FBI says it did not properly follow-up tip on accused Florida shooter" border="0" ></a>The FBI said on Friday that a tip it received about accused Florida shooter Nikolas Cruz should have caused him to be assessed as a threat, but proper protocols were not followed and the information was not sent to its Miami office for follow-up.  "Under established protocols, the information provided by the caller should have been assessed as a potential threat to life. The information then should have been forwarded to the FBI Miami field office, where appropriate investigative steps would have been taken," the FBI said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/fbi-says-did-not-properly-tip-accused-florida-175413819.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 14:10:33 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">fbi-says-did-not-properly-tip-accused-florida-175413819.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/fbi-says-did-not-properly-tip-accused-florida-175413819.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="FBI says it did not properly follow-up tip on accused Florida shooter" align="left" title="FBI says it did not properly follow-up tip on accused Florida shooter" border="0" ></a>The FBI said on Friday that a tip it received about accused Florida shooter Nikolas Cruz should have caused him to be assessed as a threat, but proper protocols were not followed and the information was not sent to its Miami office for follow-up.  "Under established protocols, the information provided by the caller should have been assessed as a potential threat to life. The information then should have been forwarded to the FBI Miami field office, where appropriate investigative steps would have been taken," the FBI said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Al Qaeda operative gets life sentence for killing soldiers, bomb plot</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/al-qaeda-operative-gets-life-sentence-killing-soldiers-180756136.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/39n5DxJRIRTjwt8JkZShSw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T180756Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1ES_RTROPTP_2_NEW-YORK-SECURITY-ALQAEDA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Al Qaeda operative gets life sentence for killing soldiers, bomb plot" align="left" title="Al Qaeda operative gets life sentence for killing soldiers, bomb plot" border="0" ></a>A man convicted of participating in a 2003 attack on American soldiers in Afghanistan that killed two people and plotting to bomb a U.S. embassy in West Africa was sentenced to life in prison on Friday.  Ibrahim Suleiman Adnan Adam Harun, who is known by the nom de guerre Spin Ghul, was sentenced by U.S. District Judge Brian Cogan in Brooklyn.  Harun refused to attend his sentencing hearing, as he had previously refused to attend his trial.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/al-qaeda-operative-gets-life-sentence-killing-soldiers-180756136.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 13:07:56 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">al-qaeda-operative-gets-life-sentence-killing-soldiers-180756136.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/39n5DxJRIRTjwt8JkZShSw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T180756Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1ES_RTROPTP_2_NEW-YORK-SECURITY-ALQAEDA.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/al-qaeda-operative-gets-life-sentence-killing-soldiers-180756136.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/39n5DxJRIRTjwt8JkZShSw--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T180756Z_1_LYNXNPEE1F1ES_RTROPTP_2_NEW-YORK-SECURITY-ALQAEDA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Al Qaeda operative gets life sentence for killing soldiers, bomb plot" align="left" title="Al Qaeda operative gets life sentence for killing soldiers, bomb plot" border="0" ></a>A man convicted of participating in a 2003 attack on American soldiers in Afghanistan that killed two people and plotting to bomb a U.S. embassy in West Africa was sentenced to life in prison on Friday.  Ibrahim Suleiman Adnan Adam Harun, who is known by the nom de guerre Spin Ghul, was sentenced by U.S. District Judge Brian Cogan in Brooklyn.  Harun refused to attend his sentencing hearing, as he had previously refused to attend his trial.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-brave-faculty-model-students-among-17-shot-002022410.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" align="left" title="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - A beloved assistant football coach who acted as a human shield to save others was among the 17 people killed in South Florida when a gunman opened fire this week in the second-deadliest shooting ever at a public school in the United States.  Following are profiles of the victims, whose names were officially released on Thursday evening by Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel.  The victims' loved ones have posted memorials on social media:  AARON FEIS, 37, COACH  Altruism and courage are what drove Feis, an assistant football coach, to give his life to save others, the local sheriff and others said.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-brave-faculty-model-students-among-17-shot-002022410.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 09:22:31 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">factbox-brave-faculty-model-students-among-17-shot-002022410.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-brave-faculty-model-students-among-17-shot-002022410.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" align="left" title="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - A beloved assistant football coach who acted as a human shield to save others was among the 17 people killed in South Florida when a gunman opened fire this week in the second-deadliest shooting ever at a public school in the United States.  Following are profiles of the victims, whose names were officially released on Thursday evening by Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel.  The victims' loved ones have posted memorials on social media:  AARON FEIS, 37, COACH  Altruism and courage are what drove Feis, an assistant football coach, to give his life to save others, the local sheriff and others said.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Gone with the wind: storms deepen Florida&#39;s beach sand crunch</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/gone-wind-storms-deepen-floridas-beach-sand-crunch-100828994.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/jKdxCOsNY0VWdNPKXqV4cA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T100828Z_2_LYNXNPEE1F0N4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-STORM-BEACHES.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Gone with the wind: storms deepen Florida&#39;s beach sand crunch" align="left" title="Gone with the wind: storms deepen Florida&#39;s beach sand crunch" border="0" ></a>By Laila Kearney  FLAGLER COUNTY, Fla (Reuters) - Down the palm tree-lined roads of northeast Florida's Flagler County, a half-dozen dump trucks are shuttling back and forth along the Atlantic coast pouring thousands of tons of sand onto the local beach.  Getting enough of it, for the right price and in time for the peak tourist season, has become much harder after a violent storm year that brought Irma, the most powerful hurricane to hit the state in over a decade, and saddled Florida with more than $50 billion in damage.  Costs of so-called beach renourishments are a fraction of the total, measured in hundreds of millions of dollars, but the effort is crucial for Florida's $67 billion tourism industry.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/gone-wind-storms-deepen-floridas-beach-sand-crunch-100828994.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 05:24:19 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">gone-wind-storms-deepen-floridas-beach-sand-crunch-100828994.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/jKdxCOsNY0VWdNPKXqV4cA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T100828Z_2_LYNXNPEE1F0N4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-STORM-BEACHES.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/gone-wind-storms-deepen-floridas-beach-sand-crunch-100828994.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/jKdxCOsNY0VWdNPKXqV4cA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T100828Z_2_LYNXNPEE1F0N4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-STORM-BEACHES.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Gone with the wind: storms deepen Florida&#39;s beach sand crunch" align="left" title="Gone with the wind: storms deepen Florida&#39;s beach sand crunch" border="0" ></a>By Laila Kearney  FLAGLER COUNTY, Fla (Reuters) - Down the palm tree-lined roads of northeast Florida's Flagler County, a half-dozen dump trucks are shuttling back and forth along the Atlantic coast pouring thousands of tons of sand onto the local beach.  Getting enough of it, for the right price and in time for the peak tourist season, has become much harder after a violent storm year that brought Irma, the most powerful hurricane to hit the state in over a decade, and saddled Florida with more than $50 billion in damage.  Costs of so-called beach renourishments are a fraction of the total, measured in hundreds of millions of dollars, but the effort is crucial for Florida's $67 billion tourism industry.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Britain&#39;s Balfour says joint venture bags $1.95 billion U.S. airport contract</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/britains-balfour-says-joint-venture-bags-1-95-072622959--sector.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Britain&#39;s Balfour says joint venture bags $1.95 billion U.S. airport contract" align="left" title="Britain&#39;s Balfour says joint venture bags $1.95 billion U.S. airport contract" border="0" ></a>The design and build part of the contract has been awarded to a joint venture of construction groups, in which Balfour and Fluor Corp each have 30 percent stakes, while Flatiron West and Dragados USA each have 20 percent stakes.  The contract will include designing and building a 2.25-mile (3.6 km) long, above ground airport transport system to connect LAX central terminal area to a rental car facility, six stations and a vehicle maintenance facility, Balfour said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/britains-balfour-says-joint-venture-bags-1-95-072622959--sector.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 02:26:22 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">britains-balfour-says-joint-venture-bags-1-95-072622959--sector.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/britains-balfour-says-joint-venture-bags-1-95-072622959--sector.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Britain&#39;s Balfour says joint venture bags $1.95 billion U.S. airport contract" align="left" title="Britain&#39;s Balfour says joint venture bags $1.95 billion U.S. airport contract" border="0" ></a>The design and build part of the contract has been awarded to a joint venture of construction groups, in which Balfour and Fluor Corp each have 30 percent stakes, while Flatiron West and Dragados USA each have 20 percent stakes.  The contract will include designing and building a 2.25-mile (3.6 km) long, above ground airport transport system to connect LAX central terminal area to a rental car facility, six stations and a vehicle maintenance facility, Balfour said in a statement.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Rights group sues to block Ohio Down syndrome abortion ban</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/rights-group-sues-block-ohio-down-syndrome-abortion-033818679.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/hZqb1Vl_atC.Rnyw.MR6Hg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T033818Z_3_LYNXNPEE1E1W2_RTROPTP_2_USA-COURT-ABORTION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Rights group sues to block Ohio Down syndrome abortion ban" align="left" title="Rights group sues to block Ohio Down syndrome abortion ban" border="0" ></a>By Kim Palmer  CLEVELAND (Reuters) - The ACLU filed a lawsuit on Thursday challenging an Ohio law that criminalizes abortions if a doctor performing a termination is aware that the woman has received a diagnosis that her fetus has Down syndrome.  The Ohio state chapter of the American Civil Liberties union filed the lawsuit in the U.S. District Court in Cincinnati, arguing the law violated the liberty and privacy clause of the Fourteenth Amendment of the U.S. Constitution.  The lawsuit, filed on behalf of Cleveland abortion provider Preterm, seeks to delay enforcement of the law, which is scheduled to go into effect March 23.The law was passed by the state legislature and signed by Governor John Kasich last December.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/rights-group-sues-block-ohio-down-syndrome-abortion-033818679.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 22:38:18 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">rights-group-sues-block-ohio-down-syndrome-abortion-033818679.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/hZqb1Vl_atC.Rnyw.MR6Hg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T033818Z_3_LYNXNPEE1E1W2_RTROPTP_2_USA-COURT-ABORTION.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/rights-group-sues-block-ohio-down-syndrome-abortion-033818679.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/hZqb1Vl_atC.Rnyw.MR6Hg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-16T033818Z_3_LYNXNPEE1E1W2_RTROPTP_2_USA-COURT-ABORTION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Rights group sues to block Ohio Down syndrome abortion ban" align="left" title="Rights group sues to block Ohio Down syndrome abortion ban" border="0" ></a>By Kim Palmer  CLEVELAND (Reuters) - The ACLU filed a lawsuit on Thursday challenging an Ohio law that criminalizes abortions if a doctor performing a termination is aware that the woman has received a diagnosis that her fetus has Down syndrome.  The Ohio state chapter of the American Civil Liberties union filed the lawsuit in the U.S. District Court in Cincinnati, arguing the law violated the liberty and privacy clause of the Fourteenth Amendment of the U.S. Constitution.  The lawsuit, filed on behalf of Cleveland abortion provider Preterm, seeks to delay enforcement of the law, which is scheduled to go into effect March 23.The law was passed by the state legislature and signed by Governor John Kasich last December.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>U.S. Senate rejects immigration bills, leaves Dreamers in limbo</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-senate-rejects-immigration-bills-leaves-dreamers-limbo-030149392.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. Senate rejects immigration bills, leaves Dreamers in limbo" align="left" title="U.S. Senate rejects immigration bills, leaves Dreamers in limbo" border="0" ></a>The U.S. Senate rejected a series of bills to protect "Dreamer" immigrants on Thursday, leaving in limbo the future of 1.8 million young adults brought to the United States illegally as children.  The Senate failed to get the 60 votes needed to move forward on four separate proposals, including one backed by President Donald Trump and a separate bipartisan bill that had been the most likely to win approval in the deeply divided Senate.  In a blow to the Republican president, 14 senators from his own party opposed that bill, which failed by an emphatic 60-39 vote.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-senate-rejects-immigration-bills-leaves-dreamers-limbo-030149392.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 22:01:49 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-senate-rejects-immigration-bills-leaves-dreamers-limbo-030149392.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-senate-rejects-immigration-bills-leaves-dreamers-limbo-030149392.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. Senate rejects immigration bills, leaves Dreamers in limbo" align="left" title="U.S. Senate rejects immigration bills, leaves Dreamers in limbo" border="0" ></a>The U.S. Senate rejected a series of bills to protect "Dreamer" immigrants on Thursday, leaving in limbo the future of 1.8 million young adults brought to the United States illegally as children.  The Senate failed to get the 60 votes needed to move forward on four separate proposals, including one backed by President Donald Trump and a separate bipartisan bill that had been the most likely to win approval in the deeply divided Senate.  In a blow to the Republican president, 14 senators from his own party opposed that bill, which failed by an emphatic 60-39 vote.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Telltale internet message may have foreshadowed Florida school massacre</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/telltale-internet-message-may-foreshadowed-florida-school-massacre-024818895.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/GRMGeA_VUYj_4k7ndGDEwg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T195808Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E1W4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Telltale internet message may have foreshadowed Florida school massacre" align="left" title="Telltale internet message may have foreshadowed Florida school massacre" border="0" ></a>The 19-year-old man accused of shooting 17 people to death at a Florida high school legally purchased the assault rifle used in the killings and may have foreshadowed the attack in a social media comment investigated by the FBI last year, authorities said on Thursday.  New details about the troubled background and gun ownership of the suspect, Nikolas Cruz, emerged as he appeared in court to face formal charges of carrying out the second-deadliest mass shooting at a public school in U.S. history.  The tragedy in the Miami suburb of Parkland, Florida, raised questions among anguished parents about the adequacy of school security measures and renewed a national debate on Capitol Hill and elsewhere about the epidemic of gun violence in American schools.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/telltale-internet-message-may-foreshadowed-florida-school-massacre-024818895.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 22:01:03 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">telltale-internet-message-may-foreshadowed-florida-school-massacre-024818895.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/GRMGeA_VUYj_4k7ndGDEwg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T195808Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E1W4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/telltale-internet-message-may-foreshadowed-florida-school-massacre-024818895.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/GRMGeA_VUYj_4k7ndGDEwg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T195808Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E1W4_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Telltale internet message may have foreshadowed Florida school massacre" align="left" title="Telltale internet message may have foreshadowed Florida school massacre" border="0" ></a>The 19-year-old man accused of shooting 17 people to death at a Florida high school legally purchased the assault rifle used in the killings and may have foreshadowed the attack in a social media comment investigated by the FBI last year, authorities said on Thursday.  New details about the troubled background and gun ownership of the suspect, Nikolas Cruz, emerged as he appeared in court to face formal charges of carrying out the second-deadliest mass shooting at a public school in U.S. history.  The tragedy in the Miami suburb of Parkland, Florida, raised questions among anguished parents about the adequacy of school security measures and renewed a national debate on Capitol Hill and elsewhere about the epidemic of gun violence in American schools.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Former NY City teacher, brother charged with attempted bomb-making</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/two-men-arrested-york-city-bomb-making-material-001540743.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Former NY City teacher, brother charged with attempted bomb-making" align="left" title="Former NY City teacher, brother charged with attempted bomb-making" border="0" ></a>Christian Toro, the former teacher, and his brother Tyler Toro, both 27, had stockpiled materials for making bombs in the apartment they shared in the city's Bronx borough, according to a criminal complaint and the Department of Justice.  Law enforcement agents, in a search of the brothers' apartment, found a backpack with an index card reading, "Under the full moon the small ones will know terror," the complaint said.  Agents also found a book that appeared to be a diary with Tyler Toro's name on it, with a line saying, "WE ARE TWIN TOROS STRIKE US NOW, WE WILL RETURN WITH NANO THERMITE,” the complaint said.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/two-men-arrested-york-city-bomb-making-material-001540743.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 21:30:42 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">two-men-arrested-york-city-bomb-making-material-001540743.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/two-men-arrested-york-city-bomb-making-material-001540743.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Former NY City teacher, brother charged with attempted bomb-making" align="left" title="Former NY City teacher, brother charged with attempted bomb-making" border="0" ></a>Christian Toro, the former teacher, and his brother Tyler Toro, both 27, had stockpiled materials for making bombs in the apartment they shared in the city's Bronx borough, according to a criminal complaint and the Department of Justice.  Law enforcement agents, in a search of the brothers' apartment, found a backpack with an index card reading, "Under the full moon the small ones will know terror," the complaint said.  Agents also found a book that appeared to be a diary with Tyler Toro's name on it, with a line saying, "WE ARE TWIN TOROS STRIKE US NOW, WE WILL RETURN WITH NANO THERMITE,” the complaint said.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>New York top court clears man held six years at Rikers Island without trial</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/york-top-court-clears-man-held-six-years-000006367.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="New York top court clears man held six years at Rikers Island without trial" align="left" title="New York top court clears man held six years at Rikers Island without trial" border="0" ></a>A divided New York State Court of Appeals, the state's highest court, on Thursday threw out the indictment of a man who spent more than six years in the Rikers Island jail in a Manhattan murder case, saying his constitutional right to a speedy trial was violated.  The 4-3 decision favoring Reginald Wiggins came less than a month after the federal appeals court in Manhattan dismissed on speedy trial grounds the indictment of an upstate man, Joseph Tigano, held for nearly seven years before being convicted on marijuana charges.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/york-top-court-clears-man-held-six-years-000006367.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 19:00:06 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">york-top-court-clears-man-held-six-years-000006367.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/york-top-court-clears-man-held-six-years-000006367.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="New York top court clears man held six years at Rikers Island without trial" align="left" title="New York top court clears man held six years at Rikers Island without trial" border="0" ></a>A divided New York State Court of Appeals, the state's highest court, on Thursday threw out the indictment of a man who spent more than six years in the Rikers Island jail in a Manhattan murder case, saying his constitutional right to a speedy trial was violated.  The 4-3 decision favoring Reginald Wiggins came less than a month after the federal appeals court in Manhattan dismissed on speedy trial grounds the indictment of an upstate man, Joseph Tigano, held for nearly seven years before being convicted on marijuana charges.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>West Virginia man admits to fraud tied to Boston art heist</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/west-virginia-man-admits-fraud-tied-boston-art-234400763.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/lcc.DUxXFNMq8c1lnPwdnQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T234400Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E24D_RTROPTP_2_USA-CRIME-GARDNER.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="West Virginia man admits to fraud tied to Boston art heist" align="left" title="West Virginia man admits to fraud tied to Boston art heist" border="0" ></a>A West Virginia man pleaded guilty on Thursday to charges he fraudulently offered to sell some of the $500 million in artwork that was stolen from a Boston museum in 1990 and never recovered, even though he had no access to the paintings.  Todd Desper, 48, entered his plea in Boston federal court to wire fraud charges related to a scheme in which he offered to sell two paintings stolen from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in the largest art heist in U.S. history.  The charge of wire fraud carries a maximum sentence of 20 years.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/west-virginia-man-admits-fraud-tied-boston-art-234400763.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:44:00 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">west-virginia-man-admits-fraud-tied-boston-art-234400763.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/lcc.DUxXFNMq8c1lnPwdnQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T234400Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E24D_RTROPTP_2_USA-CRIME-GARDNER.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/west-virginia-man-admits-fraud-tied-boston-art-234400763.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/lcc.DUxXFNMq8c1lnPwdnQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T234400Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E24D_RTROPTP_2_USA-CRIME-GARDNER.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="West Virginia man admits to fraud tied to Boston art heist" align="left" title="West Virginia man admits to fraud tied to Boston art heist" border="0" ></a>A West Virginia man pleaded guilty on Thursday to charges he fraudulently offered to sell some of the $500 million in artwork that was stolen from a Boston museum in 1990 and never recovered, even though he had no access to the paintings.  Todd Desper, 48, entered his plea in Boston federal court to wire fraud charges related to a scheme in which he offered to sell two paintings stolen from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in the largest art heist in U.S. history.  The charge of wire fraud carries a maximum sentence of 20 years.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>U.S. officials warn &#39;intense&#39; flu season to continue, urge shots</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-officials-warn-intense-flu-season-continue-urge-232132121.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ZxmkwxgBL2W2mg7EyT6qwg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T232132Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E23W_RTROPTP_2_USA-HEALTHCARE-FLU.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. officials warn &#39;intense&#39; flu season to continue, urge shots" align="left" title="U.S. officials warn &#39;intense&#39; flu season to continue, urge shots" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - Adults who get a flu shot are 36 percent less likely to get the disease, while for children the figure was an unexpectedly high 59 percent, U.S. health officials said on Thursday, predicting that the current "intense" season could continue for weeks.  Anyone not already immunized should get a flu shot despite the lateness of the season, because "some protection is better than none," one of the officials told a news briefing.  A total of 63 children in the United States have died of influenza this season, and three-quarters of them did not get a vaccine, said Anne Schuchat, acting director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-officials-warn-intense-flu-season-continue-urge-232132121.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:21:32 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-officials-warn-intense-flu-season-continue-urge-232132121.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ZxmkwxgBL2W2mg7EyT6qwg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T232132Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E23W_RTROPTP_2_USA-HEALTHCARE-FLU.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-officials-warn-intense-flu-season-continue-urge-232132121.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ZxmkwxgBL2W2mg7EyT6qwg--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T232132Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E23W_RTROPTP_2_USA-HEALTHCARE-FLU.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. officials warn &#39;intense&#39; flu season to continue, urge shots" align="left" title="U.S. officials warn &#39;intense&#39; flu season to continue, urge shots" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - Adults who get a flu shot are 36 percent less likely to get the disease, while for children the figure was an unexpectedly high 59 percent, U.S. health officials said on Thursday, predicting that the current "intense" season could continue for weeks.  Anyone not already immunized should get a flu shot despite the lateness of the season, because "some protection is better than none," one of the officials told a news briefing.  A total of 63 children in the United States have died of influenza this season, and three-quarters of them did not get a vaccine, said Anne Schuchat, acting director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>U.S. charges Chicago trader with stealing bitcoin</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-chicago-trader-stealing-bitcoin-232117784--sector.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/EVmmHkOJoXXxjgRuFxYhGA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T232216Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E23X_RTROPTP_2_MARKETS-BITCOIN-INDIA-TAXES.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. charges Chicago trader with stealing bitcoin" align="left" title="U.S. charges Chicago trader with stealing bitcoin" border="0" ></a>Joseph Kim, 24, is the first person facing criminal prosecution in Chicago involving the cryptocurrency trading industry, according to the office of U.S. Attorney John Lausch in that city, which announced the case.  A lawyer for Kim could not immediately be identified.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-chicago-trader-stealing-bitcoin-232117784--sector.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:21:17 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-charges-chicago-trader-stealing-bitcoin-232117784--sector.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/EVmmHkOJoXXxjgRuFxYhGA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T232216Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E23X_RTROPTP_2_MARKETS-BITCOIN-INDIA-TAXES.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/u-charges-chicago-trader-stealing-bitcoin-232117784--sector.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/EVmmHkOJoXXxjgRuFxYhGA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T232216Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E23X_RTROPTP_2_MARKETS-BITCOIN-INDIA-TAXES.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="U.S. charges Chicago trader with stealing bitcoin" align="left" title="U.S. charges Chicago trader with stealing bitcoin" border="0" ></a>Joseph Kim, 24, is the first person facing criminal prosecution in Chicago involving the cryptocurrency trading industry, according to the office of U.S. Attorney John Lausch in that city, which announced the case.  A lawyer for Kim could not immediately be identified.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-brave-coach-star-students-among-17-shot-192155983.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" align="left" title="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" border="0" ></a>Altruism and courage are what drove Feis, an assistant football coach, to give his life to save others, the local sheriff and others said.  “The kids in this community loved him, they adored him ... He was killed tragically, inhumanely, he did it protecting others,” Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel told a news conference.  In a tweet, the high school football team said Feis, who was married with a baby daughter, "selflessly shielded students from the shooter when he was shot.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-brave-coach-star-students-among-17-shot-192155983.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:18:16 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">factbox-brave-coach-star-students-among-17-shot-192155983.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/factbox-brave-coach-star-students-among-17-shot-192155983.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" align="left" title="Factbox: Brave faculty, model students among 17 shot dead at Florida school" border="0" ></a>Altruism and courage are what drove Feis, an assistant football coach, to give his life to save others, the local sheriff and others said.  “The kids in this community loved him, they adored him ... He was killed tragically, inhumanely, he did it protecting others,” Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel told a news conference.  In a tweet, the high school football team said Feis, who was married with a baby daughter, "selflessly shielded students from the shooter when he was shot.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Seattle ICE lawyer admits stealing immigrants&#39; identities for cash</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/seattle-ice-lawyer-admits-stealing-immigrants-identities-cash-231514699.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Seattle ICE lawyer admits stealing immigrants&#39; identities for cash" align="left" title="Seattle ICE lawyer admits stealing immigrants&#39; identities for cash" border="0" ></a>Raphael A. Sanchez, 44, will be sentenced on May 11 in U.S. District Court in Seattle on charges of wire fraud and aggravated identity theft, the Department of Justice said Thursday.  Prosecutors said Sanchez, who had responsibility over immigration removal proceedings in Alaska, Idaho, Oregon and Washington, devised a scheme to defraud seven aliens in various stages of immigration removal proceedings.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/seattle-ice-lawyer-admits-stealing-immigrants-identities-cash-231514699.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:15:14 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">seattle-ice-lawyer-admits-stealing-immigrants-identities-cash-231514699.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/seattle-ice-lawyer-admits-stealing-immigrants-identities-cash-231514699.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Seattle ICE lawyer admits stealing immigrants&#39; identities for cash" align="left" title="Seattle ICE lawyer admits stealing immigrants&#39; identities for cash" border="0" ></a>Raphael A. Sanchez, 44, will be sentenced on May 11 in U.S. District Court in Seattle on charges of wire fraud and aggravated identity theft, the Department of Justice said Thursday.  Prosecutors said Sanchez, who had responsibility over immigration removal proceedings in Alaska, Idaho, Oregon and Washington, devised a scheme to defraud seven aliens in various stages of immigration removal proceedings.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Gun restraining order might have thwarted Florida shooting: experts</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/gun-restraining-order-might-thwarted-florida-shooting-experts-225519983.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/TngSaH0WnViQHJ7AkQlrIQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T225519Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E239_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Gun restraining order might have thwarted Florida shooting: experts" align="left" title="Gun restraining order might have thwarted Florida shooting: experts" border="0" ></a>Some gun control proponents and legal experts said Wednesday's school shooting might have been thwarted if it had.  Suspected shooter Nikolas Cruz's history of violence in school and disturbing social media posts would have allowed authorities to prevent him from legally obtaining a firearm in California and Connecticut, which have gun violence restraining order (GVRO) statutes, the experts said.  The killing of 17 students and staff members at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, could give new momentum to such laws.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/gun-restraining-order-might-thwarted-florida-shooting-experts-225519983.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:55:19 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">gun-restraining-order-might-thwarted-florida-shooting-experts-225519983.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/TngSaH0WnViQHJ7AkQlrIQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T225519Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E239_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/gun-restraining-order-might-thwarted-florida-shooting-experts-225519983.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/TngSaH0WnViQHJ7AkQlrIQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T225519Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E239_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Gun restraining order might have thwarted Florida shooting: experts" align="left" title="Gun restraining order might have thwarted Florida shooting: experts" border="0" ></a>Some gun control proponents and legal experts said Wednesday's school shooting might have been thwarted if it had.  Suspected shooter Nikolas Cruz's history of violence in school and disturbing social media posts would have allowed authorities to prevent him from legally obtaining a firearm in California and Connecticut, which have gun violence restraining order (GVRO) statutes, the experts said.  The killing of 17 students and staff members at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, could give new momentum to such laws.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Accused Florida gunman visited restaurants, store after killing: police</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-community-seeks-answers-17-killed-school-rampage-104806264.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/GzVoRDTIN1y8kQ4YqkD6iQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T122920Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E0ZN_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Accused Florida gunman visited restaurants, store after killing: police" align="left" title="Accused Florida gunman visited restaurants, store after killing: police" border="0" ></a>By Bernie Woodall and Zachary Fagenson  PARKLAND, Fla. (Reuters) - The 19-year-old man accused of killing 17 people at a Florida high school fled hidden in a crowd of frightened students and  visited two fast food restaurants before he was arrested less than two hours after the massacre, officials said on Thursday.  Authorities said the alleged gunman, Nikolas Cruz, stopped at a Wal-Mart, a Subway restaurant and a McDonald's immediately after carrying out the second-deadliest mass shooting at a public school in U.S. history.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-community-seeks-answers-17-killed-school-rampage-104806264.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:45:51 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">florida-community-seeks-answers-17-killed-school-rampage-104806264.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/GzVoRDTIN1y8kQ4YqkD6iQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T122920Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E0ZN_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-community-seeks-answers-17-killed-school-rampage-104806264.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/GzVoRDTIN1y8kQ4YqkD6iQ--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2018-02-15T122920Z_1_LYNXNPEE1E0ZN_RTROPTP_2_FLORIDA-SHOOTING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Accused Florida gunman visited restaurants, store after killing: police" align="left" title="Accused Florida gunman visited restaurants, store after killing: police" border="0" ></a>By Bernie Woodall and Zachary Fagenson  PARKLAND, Fla. (Reuters) - The 19-year-old man accused of killing 17 people at a Florida high school fled hidden in a crowd of frightened students and  visited two fast food restaurants before he was arrested less than two hours after the massacre, officials said on Thursday.  Authorities said the alleged gunman, Nikolas Cruz, stopped at a Wal-Mart, a Subway restaurant and a McDonald's immediately after carrying out the second-deadliest mass shooting at a public school in U.S. history.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Florida victim&#39;s mom screams: &#39;Trump stop guns getting into children&#39;s hands&#39;</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-victims-mom-screams-trump-stop-guns-getting-223144240.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Florida victim&#39;s mom screams: &#39;Trump stop guns getting into children&#39;s hands&#39;" align="left" title="Florida victim&#39;s mom screams: &#39;Trump stop guns getting into children&#39;s hands&#39;" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - The anguished mother of a girl slain with 16 other people by a gunman at a Florida high school took to national television on Thursday to angrily demand that U.S. President Donald Trump "do something" to protect school children from gun violence.  "President Trump, you say what can you do?  ... You can do a lot," Lori Alhadeff shouted into the camera in an emotionally raw appearance on CNN.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-victims-mom-screams-trump-stop-guns-getting-223144240.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:31:44 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">florida-victims-mom-screams-trump-stop-guns-getting-223144240.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/florida-victims-mom-screams-trump-stop-guns-getting-223144240.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="Florida victim&#39;s mom screams: &#39;Trump stop guns getting into children&#39;s hands&#39;" align="left" title="Florida victim&#39;s mom screams: &#39;Trump stop guns getting into children&#39;s hands&#39;" border="0" ></a>(Reuters) - The anguished mother of a girl slain with 16 other people by a gunman at a Florida high school took to national television on Thursday to angrily demand that U.S. President Donald Trump "do something" to protect school children from gun violence.  "President Trump, you say what can you do?  ... You can do a lot," Lori Alhadeff shouted into the camera in an emotionally raw appearance on CNN.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item></channel></rss>
